discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Its A: OAuth authentication provides a secure method for authentication and authorization without exposing user credentials (username-password) to the API service. Instead, OAuth relies on access tokens issued by an authorization server after verifying the userâ€™s credentials. These tokens are then used for API access, ensuring security while preventing direct transmission of username-password combinations.

Selected Answer: A
It should be OAuth Authentication . Correct Answer: A

comments.content: While Digest Authentication hashes credentials before transmission, it still involves sending credentials in some form, which contradicts the requirement of not sending them to the API service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
RFC 7616. This method enhances security by avoiding the transmission of passwords in clear text. It employs a challenge-response mechanism that uses a cryptographic hash function, ensuring that passwords are never sent directly over the network.

questions.question_text: A developer prepares an API to be used by administrators. API requires username and password to be verified for validated access to data, however username-password combination of users must not be sent to the API service itself. Authentication and authorization will be provided over the same mechanism. Which authentication mechanism must be used by the API service?

choices.D: JSON has more common usage in configuration management tools compared to YAML.
choices.C: YAML is a more verbose data structure compared to JSON.
choices.A: YAML has a more consistent approach to representing data compared to JSON.
choices.B: JSON does not support comments and YAML does.

discussion.content:
Answer is B 
Can I use comments in JSON?
No, JSON is a data-only format. Comments in the form //, #, or /* */, which are used in popular programming languages, are not allowed in JSON. You can add comments to JSON as custom JSON elements that will hold your comments, but these elements will still be data.

Selected Answer: B
I went to the link and it says json does not support comments

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
VLANs are different IP address subnetworks

Selected Answer: D
It's a best practice, but is not enforced. MACs are enforced. Also the IP header doesn't have any VLAN ID field. However the Ethernet Header have fields for MAC Addr and VLAN ID. So it's D for sure.

A is the correct answer

Provided answer is correct you can put two ip addresses in the same network in different vlan and they won't be able to talk to each other
